commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: As the student council president, I, Nana Nakagawa...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Morning everyone. It's finally the day of the public debate, Nana. Did you sleep well last night?

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Good morning. I'm actually rather nervous. I don't even get this nervous when I perform on stage as a school idol.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: More importantly, what exactly is a public debate?! I'm surprised at all the things that are involved in this process!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: It must be terrifying to participate in an event where you're clearly having judgment passed on you.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: And we have to watch it through the school broadcasting system, right? I hate that we can only watch you when we really want to cheer for you in person.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I agree. That's why we should all gather in the cafeteria at lunch to watch it together.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: All right, let's do that.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We'll all be cheering you on together, okay? You're not alone. Don't forget that we're all here for you.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I won't! Thank you so much. I'll do my best!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Maybe we should create an altar out of novels and DVDs to pray for certain victory, Setsu-- I mean, Nana.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: An a-altar? That does sound interesting... I mean, no! I don't need anything like that!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Now, now, no need to be shy!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I'll take a photo of the altar for you. Rina-chan Board says, "Tense!"

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I told you, I don't need an altar!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: No need to worry! We'll decorate it real nice and cute for you!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I said, that's not what I mean. I don't need an altar! Geez, why do I have to deal with this when the debate is about to start?!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: *Giggle* Looks like that loosened up your shoulders. Now you won't head into the debate with stiff nerves.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Huh? Oh, yes, maybe you are right about that. I'm breathing much easier now!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Break a leg, Nana! We'll all be watching you!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I am delighted to finally have this outlet to express my views to all of the students at our school. Let us both do our very best.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Y-Yes. Here's to a clean and fair debate!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: (Mifune sure does appear to be full of confidence. I must hold my own as well!)

commands.speaker: Election Committee Member
commands.line: We will now begin the broadcast of the debate between the candidates for the Nijigasaki High School student council presidency. Good luck to our two candidates.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Th-Thank you very much.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Thank you.

commands.speaker: Election Committee Member
commands.line: Let us open with Shioriko Mifune and your message to all of the students.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Hello to all students of Nijigasaki High School. My name is Shioriko Mifune, and I am a first-year student running as a candidate for the new student council presidency.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The only reason I have specifically chosen to run for student council president at this time is simply that I wish to make Nijigasaki High School a better place.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: This school is very much a great place at the moment. However, it can be improved. I want to make it a place where students build confidence and experience through success.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Everybody has hidden potential within them. I would like you to use your three years here to draw out and foster your potential as much as possible.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: All students find joy and gain confidence in achieving good results. Being praised by others builds pride and acts to cultivate growth.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Student life is not all about fun. It is a period of preparation for the future. You may be unaware of skills unique to you. Let us reflect on and build these skills together.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: While you may not agree at the beginning, I am sure you will be able to push forward with hope once you see the light.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If I am elected as student council president, I will help all of you create bright, shining futures. This is my promise to everyone!

commands.speaker: Election Committee
commands.line: Thank you very much. Next up, Nana Nakagawa. Please, if you will.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: R-Right!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: (What do I do? What do I want to do for the school? I don't think I've ever put much thought into it.)

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: (Mifune is amazing. I'm...)

commands.speaker: Election Committee
commands.line: Nana? Is something the matter?

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: No, sorry. I'm okay. Hello, everyone. I'm Nana Nakagawa. I am the current student council president, and I wish to continue my tenure.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I have worked together with the student council for the sake of the school ever since being elected as president following my vote of confidence last year.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: My vision for Nijigasaki High School is...

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: (A school I want to attend... A place I want to spend three years at.)

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: A school where we can pursue our passions. High school only lasts for three short years of your life, but I think some things can only be done in these three years.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I want all students to pursue what they love. I will do everything in my power to support everyone in their endeavors to focus on the things they love.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: (Yes. I want to spend my three years in a place where my passions aren't interfered with!)

commands.speaker: Election Committee
commands.line: Thank you very much. Let us now begin the debate. Candidates, please step forward.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: First of all, please allow me to thank you for accepting my selfish request for a re-election.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I am not criticizing your entire administration of the student council. Running a stable student council is worthy of a passing grade.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: A passing grade?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: With that in mind, my position is that a school where students can pursue their passions does not support the development of students in its true essence.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: For example, what would you do for a student who wants to focus on kendo despite their lack of talent? They have no chance of being admitted into a college athletics program.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I would allow them to put their heart and soul into kendo. I believe that trying your best at what you love leads to confidence.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What kind of confidence is fostered there? Where is it of use? During tough times, will they think back and wish they had worked harder?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It does not serve as a solution for times of hardship.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Wouldn't it be more efficient for the student's future to polish their unique skills starting from their high school days, rather than focusing on their beloved kendo?

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I-Is it not perhaps a little sad to decide on everything based on efficiency?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: This is not an issue of sadness or happiness. I believe it is more important to show the student their shortest path to success in these three years, for their future.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Don't you think that's a little too bleak for the life of a student? One's love for something is more powerful than anything else!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Well, how about you, then? Are you partaking in your passions to the best of your ability?

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: What?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Have you not become half-hearted with your efforts towards your student council president duties and your passions? Do you really practice what you preach?

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: W-Well...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Your words lack persuasion unless you, the student council president who stands at the head of all students, lead by your actions.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What is the matter? This is a public debate. Do you not have any views of your own towards what I am saying?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No matter what you may say, your words lack power in your current state.
